A 35-year-old HIV-positive male presents to the emergency department with sudden onset of severe flank pain radiating to the groin, accompanied by nausea. He has been on antiretroviral therapy for the past 8 months. A urinalysis reveals microscopic hematuria, and a non-contrast CT scan shows a radio-lucent stone in the left ureter. Which of the following drug is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Tenofovir: Nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NRTI). Tenofovir can cause renal tubular dysfunction or acute kidney injury, but it does not cause nephrolithiasis. Dolutegravir:Integrase strand transfer inhibitor (INSTI). Dolutegravir is primarily associated with weight gain and neuropsychiatric side effects (e.g., insomnia, dizziness). Zidovudine: Nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NRTI). Zidovudine is associated with bone marrow suppression (anemia, neutropenia) and lactic acidosis, but it does not cause kidney stones or nephrolithiasis.

@dams_new_robot

questions.text: Which of the following is specifically approved for women with severe IBS-D who have failed other therapies?

A 12-year-old boy with ADHD has been on stimulant medications but experiences severe insomnia and agitation. His physician decides to switch to a non-stimulant medication. Which alpha-2 agonist is most commonly used to treat ADHD in children?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • • Guanfacine is an alpha-2 adrenergic agonist that modulates the prefrontal cortex by reducing sympathetic outflow, improving symptoms such as hyperactivity, impulsivity, and inattention in ADHD. • It is particularly effective for children with ADHD who cannot tolerate stimulant medications (e.g., methylphenidate) due to side effects like insomnia and agitation. • It has a calming effect and also helps with sleep regulation. atomoxetine is a non-stimulant ADHD medication, it is a norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor, not an alpha-2 agonist. Tizanidine is an alpha-2 agonist, but it is used for muscle spasticity, not ADHD. Methylphenidate is a stimulant and the first-line treatment for ADHD, but the patient has developed side effects (insomnia and agitation), which necessitate switching to a non-stimulant.

@dams_new_robot

options.label: C
options.text: 2 or more accelerations in 20-40 minutes and the accelerations must last for at least 10 seconds with increase in heart rate by 10 beats from the baseline.

questions.correct_answer: C. 2 or more accelerations in 20-40 minutes and the accelerations must last for at least 10 seconds with increase in heart rate by 10 beats from the baseline.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a component of BIOPHYSICAL PROFILE?
As per the latest partogram by WHO (LABOUR CARE GUIDE), active labour is defined as cervical dilation of how many centimetres?
Which of the following drugs’ usage in pregnancy is responsible for vaginal adenosis and vaginal clear cell cancer in the baby?
Which of the following is not an estrogenic change in the endometrium?
When is the maximum level of progesterone seen in the serum?
Amenorrhoea due to Sheehan’s syndrome is hormonally termed as?
If there is a girl who has attained thelarche, she will be considered as a case of primary amenorrhoea if she does not get menarche within _____ years. (fill in the blank)

A 32 years old nulliparous female had hirsutism, breast atrophy and clitoromegaly. On evaluation it was found that she had an ovarian tumour. It was removed and sent for histopathology exam. The following picture was seen. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which one of the biochemical changes would not be seen due to PCOS? 1: High testosterone 2: High FSH 3: High LH 4: High SHBG 5: High insulin 6: High progesterone 7: High Prolactin
A 73 years old post-menopausal patient has cancer of cervix with rt sided hydronephrosis due to ureteric obstruction caused by cancer. what is the stage of this disease?
A 23 years old nulliparous patient has had an unprotected intercourse 24 hours ago. She has taken one pill of LNG 750mcg as an emergency contraceptive now. What should be the next plan of action?

options.label: A
options.text: Take one more pill of 1500 mcg after 12 hours

options.label: B
options.text: Take one more pill of 750 mcg after 12 hours

options.label: C
options.text: No need to take any pill now.

options.label: D
options.text: Check UPT now and if it is negative then no need to take any pill now.

questions.correct_answer: B. Take one more pill of 750 mcg after 12 hours

questions.text: A 27 years old P2L2 patient is a lactating mother. Her baby is 18 months old now. She has irregular menses which are in the pattern on oligomenorrhoea. Which one is the most suitable contraceptive in this case?

A 28 years old nulliparous patient has history of vaginal discharge which occurs on day 12-13 of her cycle. There is no sign of inflammation and there is no foul smell. Her vaginal pH is 4.2. What must be the likely cause?
When is the ideal time of doing HSG in a patient with regular cycles of 28 days and who is not able to conceive?
Which one of the following is not a risk factor for the development of endometrial cancer?
Which one of the following is not seen in a case of MRKH syndrome?
Which of the following is best indicator of severe HIE?
A child has 3 days of watery diarrhea, vomiting and decreased level of consciousness. All of the following are differential diagnosis except?
What is the drug of choice for atypical HUS ?
Out of the following, which clinical feature is not seen in Down syndrome?
An infant has respiratory distress, high respiratory rate and scaphoid abdomen, in the emergency. What should be avoided?
A baby received BCG vaccine at birth and has been vaccinated at 14 weeks. Which of the following should be given at the next visit, and site?

options.label: A
options.text: MR s/c on left arm, and Oral vitamin A at 9 months completed

options.label: B
options.text: MR s/c on right arm, and Oral vitamin A at 9 months completed

options.label: C
options.text: MR s/c on left arm, and Oral vitamin A at 8 months completed

options.label: D
options.text: MR s/c on right arm, and Oral vitamin A at 8 months completed

questions.correct_answer: B. MR s/c on right arm, and Oral vitamin A at 9 months completed

questions.text: In sickle cell anemia, which drug is used to reduce the vaso-occlusive crisis?
A 10 weeks baby got DPT vaccine at 6 weeks. The baby got fever>40.5 C and severe inconsolable cry. What should be done at 10 weeks?
Meconium stained liquor. What should be done?

options.label: A
options.text: Before delivery of shoulder, suction mouth then nose

options.label: B
options.text: PPV in non vigorous child after initial steps

options.label: D
options.text: Tracheal suctioning in non vigorous baby

questions.correct_answer: B. PPV in non vigorous child after initial steps

questions.text: All of these are a criteria for severe acute malnutrition in a 6 month- old child except:

A 30-year-old patient presents with progressive difficulty in swallowing more for liquids than solids for 8 months. A barium swallow was done and is shown in the image. What other investigations should be done to confirm the diagnosis in this patient?

52-y/o F presents with dysphagia for both solids & liquids, regurgitation of food with vomiting. In addition, she also complained of severe crushing chest pain. Her cardiac evaluation was normal. Based on barium swallow done make the diagnosis?
